alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:56PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Otero County through 515 PM MDT including Boles Acres and Alamogordo... At 456 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Alamogordo, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alamogordo and Boles Acres. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 208 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 58 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
